intro: Gurania orteguazensis, commonly known as the Orteguazensis Gurania, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
